name: Minion: Absorb Ability Modifiers
description:
Requires an object to be consumed as part of the minion's summoning. 
The minion gains a creature template determined by the GM depending on what was consumed as part of it's summoning. 
For example, a necromancer raising a zombie using a dragon corpse, the zombie may gain a fire breath ability.

name: Minion: Absorb Attributes
description:
Requires an object to be consumed as part of the minion's summoning. 
The attributes of the minion, such as movement type, size, appearance, change depending on the material consumed as part of the minion's summoning.

name: Minion: Cannot Speak
description: Your minion understands your commands, but cannot reply in kind (like an animal companion). Your minion can only communicate in ways appropriate to its form.

name: Minion: Companion
description:
Incompatible with duration and activation modifiers.
Your minion is now a companion, meaning it exists as its own independent creature and remains until it dies, and must be resurrected using player rules instead of re-summoned.
Companions are generally obedient, but as their own entity, may choose to take independent action. Similarly, companion minions may also act beneficially without your instruction.

name: Minion: Controlled
description: Changes the attached minion into a controlled minion. Controlled minions cannot act independently of their owner, and consume their owner's AP to take any action.

name: Minion: Harvestable
description:
When your minion dies, it's body does not dissipate or otherwise become rendered unusable like normal. Instead, the minion's body remains as a deceased/destroyed tangible object.
The price of this extra is determined by how potentially valuable this effect may be, depending on the nature of the minion.

name: Minion: Lesser
description:
Summon a lesser minion creature, see Minion. Lesser Minions have 1 HP and 5 Characteristic points and are mostly for RP and specific minor utility purposes, such as a wizard's owl familiar or a necromancer's talking skull companion.
Pairs well with Minion: Companion.

name: Minion: Multi-Summon
description: When using AP to bring forth a minion, you may choose to bring forth an additional minion as part of the same action. This does not increase the total summon limit of a minion.

name: Minion: Rebellious
description: Your minions summoned with this flaw are not obligated inherently to follow your commands. In order to command your minion, you must persuade them via some way, shape, or means. Otherwise, your minion may easily choose to disobey, not act, or even act maliciously according to their nature.

name: Minion: Share Sense
description: Choose a sense your minion possesses, you immediately know anything the minion detects with that sense

name: Minion: Special Communication
description:
You possess a special method that allows you to communicate with your minions beyond normal verbal means, such as telepathy, special hand gestures, or similar. 
This defaults to only within visual range, but may be outside of visual range by adding the Range Extra.

name: Minion: Spell Focus
description: While your minion is within range of any abilities, you may elect to instead have the minion become the source of the ability

name: Minion: Summon
description:
Create a minion. By default only one copy of the minion can exist at a time. Re-activating this ability when at maximum minions replaces the oldest minion with a new one. When a minion hits 0 hp or its duration expires it disappears, or its body is otherwise rendered unusable.
Create a separate character sheet to keep track of your minion's stats. Its starting characteristics are determined by point buy with 14 points, but otherwise following player rules. See Minion rules.
You pay any xp costs for minion abilities/advancement at a one to one price, and the price of any minion abilities are not affected by any prices or multipliers on this Summon Ability.
Minions may not have this ability.
Cannot take the Object flaw. Minions purchased with gold are hired instead of constructed, and construct type minions are still considered creatures and not objects for targeting etc

name: Minion: Summon Elite
description: Summon an Elite enemy template, selected when you make this ability. You cannot add anything to the template.

name: Minion: Summon Grunt
description: Summon a Grunt enemy template, selected when you make this ability. You cannot add anything to the template.

name: Minion: Summon Horde
description: Create a horde minion. Functions mostly the same as Minion: Summon, but the base minion has HP based only on RES, not RES and level, all members of the horde are summoned at once, and only one horde can exist at a time.
xpCost: 10 xp per horde member, increase by 5xp per purchase.

name: Minion: Summon Limit
description:
Increase the maximum instances of a minion you may have active at once.
This limit is per minion ability, and not a passive for your entire character.

name: Minion: Summon Troop
description: Summon a Troop enemy template, selected when you make this ability. You cannot add anything to the template.

name: Minion: Tandem Attack
description:
Requires an active Minion.
When you or a minion spend AP to make a prepared action at the same time as the other, both attacks are combined into a single attack for the purposes of overcoming Damage Resistance. 
This effect may only be triggered once per turn. Your minions may also use this effect to Tandem Attack with other minions under your control.

name: Range
description:
Increases the distance an ability can reach by making the ability a projectile. Can attack at up to 2x distance, but DC is increased by 2 when beyond purchased distance.
Area of Effect abilities trigger their area when they strike a target up to this range.
xpCost:
0 - melee
5 xp per square/meter of range

name: Range: Area Effect Circle
description: Add radius to a circle shaped Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect
xpCost: 20xp per square of radius, +20xp per purchase

name: Range: Area Effect Cone
description: Add range to a cone shaped Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect
xpCost:
10xp per square of 45 degrees +10xp per purchase
15xp per square of 90 degrees +15xp per purchase

name: Range: Area Effect Height
description: Add squares of height to an Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect

name: Range: Area Effect Line
description: Add squares of distance to a Line shaped Area of Effect. Requires Target: Area of Effect

name: Range: Area Effect Sphere
description: Add radius to a sphere shaped Area of Effect. RequiresTarget: Area of Effect
xpCost: 25xp per square of radius +25xp per purchase

name: Range: Extreme Range
description:
Requires a Utility or RP Effect.
The ability has a range best measured in kilometers rather than squares. Each square of range attached to this effect is multiplied 100x.

name: Range: Melee Reach
description: Increases the reach of a melee attack by 1 square

name: Range: Minimum Range
description: The target of the attack must be at least this far away otherwise the attack automatically fails

name: Range: Others Only
description: Only applicable to Buff or Heal effects. You can no longer target yourself for these beneficial effects.

name: Range: Self Only
description: Removes all range from an ability, allowing it to only be used upon yourself

name: Range: Thrown
description: The range of this ability is equal to your throwing range as determined by your FIT stat.

name: Range: Unlimited
description:
The attack will continue to travel until it impacts a target and is itself unaffected by gravity or distance. Ranged attacks made by this ability have a normal DC while within the ability's specified range, but increase the DC by 1 for each multiple of the ability's range. If the attack is a save instead of attack roll, reduce the save DC instead.
You may also apply this to AoE abilities.
Example: an attack with a range of 5 meters would be DC 3 (normal) to hit a target at from 0-5 meters, a DC 4 from 6-10 meters, and a DC 5 from 11-15 meters, etc
xpCost: Double the price of the range increment (Range becomes 10xp per square, Range: Area Effect Sphere becomes 50xp per square etc)

name: Target: Additional Target
description: Affect additional targets within range of this ability.

name: Target: Arcing Shot
description: Projectiles fired with this ability may be fired upwards in a parabolic arc or use a riccochet/bounce instead of directly towards a target allowing them to avoid other objects in their path so long as any path exists.

name: Target: Area of Effect
description:
Affect all targets within Area Effect. Default range includes only the original target.
By default all targets within the area are hit, with the exception of the caster if the effect is centered on the caster. If the effect is centered on the caster, it is still considered a melee attack. Range: Melee Reach increases the distance you can center the AoE and still have it count as Melee, but does not increase the size of the AoE
When making an AoE with duration choose if it targets the ground (e.g. zone of truth) or creatures (e.g. bless).
Any targets behind cover destroyed by AoE effects take leftover damage remaining after the cover was destroyed.

name: Target: Area Rings
description: Requires Target: Area of Effect . Instead of targeting all squares within an area or cone, only target the squares at the very edge of the effect.

name: Target: Chaining
description: Affect one additional target within the ability's range of the previous target

name: Target: Endless Chaining
description: Increase the DC of abilities using this effect by 1. When an ability using this effect strikes a target successfully you may spend 1 success to have this attack chain to a new target within range, there is no inherent limit to the amount of times you may trigger this chaining effect on one attack.

name: Target: Fragile Chains
description:
Requires Target Chaining. Whenever this ability strikes a target, it must succeed a skill check in order to chain to the next target. If the check fails, the chain ends.
If this flaw is combined with Endless Chaining, it increases the success cost of each chaining by 1.

name: Target: Location Targeted / Sightless
description: This abiltiy does not require line of sight on the target, instead the creature may choose a square within their range. This effect does not provide you any knowledge of the target, if you don't know where they are you have to guess.

name: Target: Multi-Hit Targets
description: When this ability targets multiple targets without using AoE effects it may elect to target the same target multiple times.

name: Target: Opposed Save
description:
Coverts a standard attack roll into an opposed skill check. The ability only activates by rolling more successes than your opponent, and your successes are reduced by your opponent's.
Your opponent by default rolls the same characteristic you used for your ability check.

name: Target: Opposed Save - High Stakes
description:
Requires Damage: Opposed Save. When you fail an opposed check against an enemy, you suffer the effects of your ability instead of your target. 
Not a valid flaw if your ability has no negative or damaging effects.

name: Target: Save
description: Target makes a save instead of you rolling for attack. Starts at normal DC of 2+1/2 CHAR

name: Target: Save - Alter CHAR
description: Changes the characteristic targeted by a save from its default of RES to any other characteristic

name: Target: Selective
description: Effect only targets creatures that meet a criteria

name: Use Mode: Charge Up
description:
When making an attack, if you spend a multiple of the AP required to make the attack, you may roll the check for the attack only once and combine the damage of those attacks into a single hit for purposes of overcoming damage resistances.
Because this becomes a single attack, any damage added by characteristics or +1 values is only added once.

name: Use Mode: Flurry
description: On a successful attack, each die of damage is treated as a separate successful attack, meaning damage bonuses from characteristics, enemy damage resistances, on hit effects, and damage type statuses apply once per die. Using this Use Mode temporarily deactivates cleaving effects like Cleaving Kills and Critical: Overkill

name: Use Mode: Focused Strike
description: When using this ability, if you spend a multiple of the AP required to make the attack, you may add 2 successes for each multiple of the attack's AP you consumed. If this ability is a save, instead of adding a success, you may increase the DC of the save.

name: Use Mode: Full Auto
description:
Requires Reloading: Magazine 
When using an ability, if you spend a multiple of the ammo required to use the ability, then the attack's damage may be applied once per each success rolled, up to the multiple of ammo spent times.

name: Use Mode: Lightning
description:
When using this ability, if you commit to using it multiple times in a row, you may reduce the AP cost by -1 for each consecutive use. 
If an ability costing 3 AP is used, it would cost 3 AP, then 2 AP, then 1 AP, then 0 or 1 AP.
As soon as you use 0 AP, the ability follows normal 0 AP rules and may no longer be used again that turn.

name: Use Mode: Prepared
description:
When using this ability, it creates some effect in the world that waits to activate when a specified condition occurs. Differs from reaction in that you spend the AP up front, and don't need to act when it triggers. The ability triggers automatically even without your character's knowledge so long as the trigger is met.
If it doesn't become triggered, the effect dispels at the end of the current encounter if it is not an object or has an extended duration. You may only have up to your number of prepared instances active in this state at one time, default 1.
Very useful for traps and ambushes.

name: Use Mode: Prepared - Additional Instances
description: Allows an increased number of prepared abilities to be manifested simultaneously, increased from the default of 1.

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Ravenous Hatred
description: At the beginning of your turn, you may spend 3 breakthrough points to unleash your destructive impulses causing all your successful attacks to deal critical damage. For the next two rounds after that your attacks deal only half damage.

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Unlimited Speed
description: At the beginning of your turn, you may spend 3 breakthrough points to break your limits on actions. You may freely spend AP to go as far into the negative as you are willing for this turn, but are subject to all rules regarding negative AP. This effect may only be triggered once per encounter.

name: Defense: Damage Redirect
description: Once per turn when you are targeted by a damaging effect you may make an opposed roll against the attack. If you roll more successes than your opponent you negate the attack, and may make a free attack against a target within range of the original ability to deal the original damage.

name: Defense: It Cut Only Thread
description:
Requires wearing Equipment that has normal durability and possesses stats of some kind.
Once per round, you may choose to halve damage taken from one action by applying that damage (unreduced) with Sunder to a piece of equipment you current have equipped and that is not immune to damage.
In order to activate this effect, this substitution must make logical sense in the current cirumstances. If an object is destroyed in any part by this effect it cannot be repaired mid-combat by any means.

name: Exploration: Foraging
description: Your character is always assumed to be able to feed themselves in any hospitable wild environment. You must still make checks to provide enough food for multiple people or within sparse or otherwise inhospitable environments, but do so with 1 free success.

name: Exploration: Internal Compass
description: Your character always knows which direction is North and gains 1 free success on any checks related to navigation or mapping

name: Exploration: Treasure Sense
description: Double your character's CUN radius for detecting hidden treasure or noticing objects of substantial monetary value. Gain 1 free success on any checks to determine the approximate gold value of any item, or to find hidden doors and the like.

name: Mounts: Evasive Maneuvers
description:
When attacked while riding a mount, you may use either the DC to hit you, or the DC to hit your mount, choosing which at will.
As long as your mount has made at least 1 movement action this round, increase the DC to hit both you and your mount by 1.

name: Spite: Hey Fuck You Pal
description: When your character loses a social combat, your next successful attack roll against the creature that defeated them in social combat becomes a critical hit.

name: Spite: My Death or Yours
description:
When this ability is used on a target if that target is not dead when all the effects of this ability is resolved, you are instantly reduced to negative your max HP.
This flaw effect may only be used on a single non-array ability per character.
tags: Death, Flaw, Self, Combat, Damage, Limited

name: Ultimate Spite
description:
Using this ability instantly kills the caster. The caster becomes permanently unable to be resurrected by any means. This ability may not be attached to summons. If this ability is attached to a minion and used, that minion ability is removed from the game. This effect also may not be attached to items.
This effect is not subject to the normal rule of a maximum 90% discount, and instead applies a 95% discount.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses Only
description:
Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses.
Removes the ability to use mimic ability when struck by abilities. You may now only mimic the abilities of corpses.

name: Cleanse: Uncleansable (Permanent)
description: A status effect with this effect attached cannot be removed by other abilities, only the death of the caster may remove it.

name: Cleanse: Uncleansable (Ultimate Spite)
description: A status effect with this effect attached cannot be removed by other abilities, even with the death of the caster.

name: Conditional: Spell Components
description:
Components like in Dungeons and Dragons.
Verbal requires a specific phrase per ability (does not have to be loud or related to the effects)
Somatic requires you to make a specific motion (so you can't do it if you are restrained, but it doesn't necessarily require a free hand)
xpCost:
Verbal: -10xp
Somatic: -10xp
Focus: See Requires Item
Material: See Requires Consumable

name: Friendliest Fire
description:
Requires an ability that may target allies with negative effects.
Damage, negative statuses, and other harmful effects caused by this abilty no longer make attack rolls or trigger saves against allies, they instead instantly cause the negative effect to the affected allies.

name: Luck: Fate's Will
description: The ability can only activate when the fate dice rolls a 6.

name: Luck: Flip of the Coin
description: The ability can only activate when succeeding a 50/50 coin flip

name: Requires being Hidden
description: To use this ability, you must be Hidden (see Stealth rules)

name: Requires Called Shot Location
description: This effect may only trigger as part of a called shot on the location specified when this flaw is taken

name: Requires Cover
description: The effect may not activate unless the character is currently in cover.

name: Requires Critical
description: This effect may only trigger when a critical hit has occurred

name: Requires Damage
description: This sub effect may only trigger if the base effect dealt damage

name: Requires Unaware target
description: Can only target unaware creatures with this ability. (see Stealth rules)

name: Shouted Ability Names
description:
Your character must shout the name of an ability in order to activate it, and abilities must have names accurate to what they do. 
Gives away what you're doing, but it feels so passionate!

name: Action Point Gain
description: Target immediately gains action points. Each target can only gain action points through this effect once per turn.

name: Action Point Loss
description: Target immediately loses action points.  Each target can only lose action points through this effect once per turn.

name: Apply Status
description: Apply a Statuses  to your target

name: Buff Ability
description:
An Ability to enhance yourself or allies. This is a general-use base for any buff effects not specified elsewhere.
The cost of the buff effect is proportional to the power of the effect.
xpCost:
Base cost 10-100 XP
10 xp - weak and simple effects (the light cantrip)
30 xp - moderately useful effects (Don't need to breathe)
50 xp - standard strength effects (see invisibility)
100 xp - very strong effects (become immune to a damage type)

name: CHAR +1 Buff
description: Add points to a characteristic. Cost assumes base characteristic is 2, and you must purchase increases in order.
xpCost: 200 xp * the number you are raising the CHAR to

name: Class Resource: Gain
description: Gain points of a class resource for using this ability

name: Cleanse: All (Meta)
description: Cleanse all negative status effects from a target. Does not require a logical means of status removal. (Requires a Meta power)

name: Cleanse: All (Physical)
description: Cleanse all negative status effects from a target. Must describe how your ability does so. (Requires a Physical power)

name: Cleanse: Single
description: Cleanse a single status effect from a target

name: Cleanse: Specific
description: Remove all ranks of a specified status effect from the target, the specified effect is chosen when this ability is purchased. Other status effects may not be cleansed.

name: Damage +1
description: Increases how much damage this attack deals by 1 of a specified damage type
xpCost:
20 xp per point
this cost increases by 20 xp each time it is purchased

name: Damage Ability / Heal Ability
description:
A combat ability whose effect is to deal or heal damage.
All die must be of the same damage type selected when this effect is first purchased.
To add damage of a second damage type purchase the Damage: Additional Type for each additional damage type.
xpCost:
70 xp for 1d6 damage
this cost increases by 70 xp each time it is purchased
Formula: 70*x*(x+1)/2

name: Death: Resurrection (Revivify / Defib)
description:
Restores a target dead creature to life, bringing them back to 1 HP but not restoring limbs/body parts that were removed.
Does not cure diseases or conditions that may lead to the target dying again the next round, those must be attached separately.
The target creature returns with all resource pools and limited-use abilities depleted.
Dead targets must be mostly physically intact and must have died within the last 10 minutes (this can be longer depending on setting and tech level, at the GM’s discretion)

name: Debuff Ability
description:
An ability that applies a status effect to a hostile, cost increases with greater debilitation.
When applying a status effect, use the XP values listed in the status effect table, otherwise use the guidelines on this effect to determine a price.
xpCost:
Base cost 10-100 XP
10 xp - weak and simple effects (enemy has glowing outline)
30 xp - moderately useful effects (slow movement)
50 xp - standard strength effects (reduce die in a check)
100 xp - very strong effects (apply vulnerable status)

name: Defense Ability
description:
An ability to mitigate damage taken. This is a general-use base for any defense effects not specified elsewhere.
The cost of the defense effect is proportional to the power of the effect.
xpCost:
Base cost 10-100 XP
10 xp - weak and simple effects 
30 xp - moderately useful effects
50 xp - standard strength effects
100 xp - very strong effects

name: Defense: Bodyguard
description: Choose a creature or object adjacent to your character, for this ability's duration, when that creature would take damage you may elect to move into their square and take that damage instead.

name: Defense: Damage Negate
description: Make a skill check and reduce incoming damage of the next attack by 1 for every success rolled in your skill check.

name: Dispel: All (Meta)
description: End all beneficial effects on a target. Does not require a logical means of removal. (Requires a Meta power)

name: Dispel: All (Physical)
description: End all beneficial effects on a target. Must describe how your ability does so. (Requires a Physical power)

name: Dispel: Single
description: End one ongoing effect on a target (either a creature/object or an effect itself like a wall of fire)

name: Dispel: Specific
description: End one specific ongoing effect on a target. E.g. end a Damage buff, end Healing over Time etc

name: Duration: Add Rounds
description:
When this ability targets a creature under the affect of a duration effect, add additional rounds of duration to that existing effect. If there are no duration effects active on the target, this effect does nothing.
You cannot add duration modifiers to this effect. If it is part of an ability with a duration, it only triggers when it is first applied, and not on subsequent rounds.

name: Forced Movement
description:
Move the target. By default, allows pushing in any direction, but you may apply a conditional for -30xp to only move in one specific direction (directly away from you, directly towards you, straight down only, etc).
”Safe” movement can’t directly deal damage. If you push someone off a cliff they grab the edge, they automatically miss hazards like fire, just stop when hitting a wall, and can’t be moved into the air to just fall. “Harmful” movement can trigger damaging effects.
Can be applied to self, may be a discount instead in certain situations (ask your GM).
How large a creature you can push with this effect depends on the Utility: Increase Size Limit of this ability, starting at size 1 creatures.
xpCost:
10 xp per meter of “safe” movement
35 xp per meter of “harmful” movement

name: Grapple
description: This ability automatically grapples the target without the need to make a check. The target can still break the grapple using normal rules. Must be used in Melee Range. See grapple rules.

name: Health: Temporary HP
description: Bestows the target creature with temporary HP, following all rules for temporary hit points.
xpCost: 5xp per 1 THP, increasing by 5xp per purchase

name: Polymorph: Baleful
description:
Transform another unwilling creature into a new shape or species after a successfull attack check. The XP value of this effect equals the approximate power level of the creature chosen when this ability is purchased, with weaker creatures costing more.
For example, turning a hulking orc into a human could cost 50 xp, but turning them into a goldish on land would cost 250 xp thanks to being essentially stunned and slowly dying.
xpCost: XP cost based on creature type chosen

name: Polymorph: Willing
description:
Transform yourself or another willing creature into a new shape or species. The XP value of this effect equals the approximate power level of the creature chosen when this ability is purchased.
For example, a goldish would cost 10 xp and allow the user to swim and breathe underwater, but little else; while a dragon would be more expensive.
xpCost: XP cost based on creature type chosen

name: Prone
description: Knocks an unwilling creature prone. See Prone rules.

name: Regeneration
description:
Restore limbs, body parts, etc after they are lost in combat, accidents, and really kinky one-night-stands.
Restores the state of the body to what would be considered "normal" for the character.

name: Roleplay Ability
description: An Ability to aid in roleplay scenarios
xpCost: 10-50 xp as determined by GM for usefulness

name: Terrain: Create
description:
This ability creates terrain to fill affected area. The type of terrain created must be selected when the ability is created.
Examples:chest high walls, pillars, a throne

name: Terrain: Destroy
description: This ability destroys squares of obstructing terrain and obstructing objects (such as walls, bookshelves, doors, etc). However, it only affects them provided their HP value is 1 or not-defined (ex: you cannot use this effect against castle walls).

name: Terrain: Difficult
description: Modify the area to cause it to be difficult terrain

name: Utility ability
description:
An ability that does a useful non-combat effect, This is a general-use base for any utility effects not specified elsewhere.
The cost of the utility effect is proportional to the power of the effect.
xpCost:
10-100 XP depending on the usefulness of the ability
10 - useful but very niche, or not particularly strong effects (Ex: Light Source)
30 - low power but wide use effects, or niche but decent
50 - abilities either with good power or wide applications
100 - very useful abilities, abilities that can be used in almost any situation

name: Utility: Alter Appearance
description:
Alter the appearance of a target up to this ability's Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit ). 
This effect only encompasses cosmetic, non-mechanical alterations. 
If you also have appearances obtained via Absorb Appearance, you may disguise the target as an exact replica of that absorbed appearance
If the target is unwilling, you must make a successful attack check to apply the alteration.
xpCost:
50 xp
10 xp for a buff that doesn’t stand up to physical inspection

name: Utility: AP Transfer
description: Target an ally within range of this ability and transfer any number of your own AP to the target. You may not go below 0 AP from this effect.

name: Utility: Illusion - Mental
description:
Create an illusory effect in the target’s mind. By default the illusion affects only one sense, and can be a static image/sensation or a simple looping one.
If the ability successfully hits (through attack roll or save) the target(s) perceives the illusion. If they pass a DC3 perception check, they see that it is an illusion. Stealth: Subtle can increase the DC of the check.

name: Utility: Illusion - Projected
description:
Create an illusory effect of a size up to this ability's Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit ).  
These illusions affect one sense per purchase, and may depict any number of objects/creatures so long as they fit within the size limit of the ability.
Creatures who pass a DC3 perception check see that it is an illusion. Stealth: Subtle can increase the DC of the check.

name: Utility: Slow Fall
description:
Applies a buff effect that reduces the speed at which the target creature falls via gravity from 50 squares a round to a nice safe 10 squares a round.
When the creature contacts the ground under this effect they do not recieve falling damage so long as they were at least 2 squares above the ground when the effect was applied.

name: Utility: Telekinesis
description:
Manipulate an object or creature at a distance up to this ability's range and Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit ). 
If the target is unwilling, you must make a successful attack check to manipulate them.

name: Utility: Telepathy
description: Apply a buff to an ally that allows mental communication with them while they remain in range.

name: Utility: Teleport
description: Teleport an object or creature up to this ability’s Size Limit (see: Utility: Increase Size Limit) within range of this ability to another point within range of this ability. If the target is unwilling, you must make a successful attack check to teleport them.

name: Wealth: Increase Value
description: Make a skill check against a non-living target, if successful increase its monetary value. This effect can only be performed once per target. Multiple characters may use this ability on the same target only if they each use a different characteristic to make the check.

name: Action Point Bank
description: May spend AP towards using ability even if you don't have enough to trigger it this round. The ability activates once it receives enough AP to activate. Useful in banking towards Use Modes like Use Mode: Charge Up

name: Action Point Cost
description:
How many AP must be spent to use this Ability

Only applicable to non Passive effects

Can also be purchased as -30 XP for each additional AP the ability takes to activate over 3 AP.
xpCost:
8 : -70% xp
7 : -60% xp
6 : -50% xp
5 : -30% xp
4 : -20% xp
3 : 0 xp
2 : +50% xp
1 : +400% xp
0 : +100% xp for instant abilities
0 : +300% xp for duration abilities

name:
Alternate Activation Conditions
(Condition Arrays)
description:
This ability may be activated in multiple ways, but only require one at time of activation.
If any of the condition sets in this array is satisified the ability may be activated.
The amount of xp refunded to the ability is equal to the condition set with the smallest xp refund in the array.
For example an ability may be activated by spending successes or by spending class resources.
xpCost: 10 xp per alternate ability contained in the array

name: Alternate Effect (Ability Arrays)
description:
This is an organizational object to hold abilities, rather than an ability itself. 
Create several abilities with a common theme and place each within this array. The xp cost of this array is equal to the most expensive ability within the array plus 20 xp per item in the array.
To change which ability in this array is active you must use a 0 AP action "Change Ability" which your character obtains for having any ability array.
The abilities must be thematically very similar, and if any modifiers are still in play, you can't use any other effect from this array without ending them. This includes things like 0 AP abilities being limited to 1/turn, duration effects, cooldowns, and a partially filled AP Bank
xpCost: 20 xp per alternate ability contained in the array

name: Buff: Requires Check
description:
Removes the default success assumption when casting a buff or other positive effect on a friendly target. Instead, the character must make an appropriate DC2 skill check and the effect only triggers if the check succeeds.
This flaw allows for gaining bonus successes on the check to spend.

name: Class Resource Cost
description: Ability costs class resources to use
xpCost: -50 xp cost per resource point consumed

name: Conditional Effect
description:
This effect can only be activated when the applied condition is true.
The condition awards more refunded XP the stricter the conditions.
See Extra Conditionals for some examples of common conditions
xpCost:
-10 relatively simple (behind enemy)
-30 some cost associated (restricts targets, narrows use)
-50 difficult to use at will (has specific requirements for use, severely narrows focus)

name: Cooldown
description:
Ability cannot be used again for a number of rounds, even if you have enough resources and action points.
Cannot have more than 5 rounds of cooldown.
xpCost: -10% xp per round of CD up to 5 rounds

name: Cooldown: Once Per Round
description:
This flaw can't be selected for a 0 AP ability that doesn't have Reaction .
This ability can only be used a single time each round, regardless of if you have enough AP to use it multiple times.

name: Cooldown: Reduced
description: When this ability is activated it reduces one active cooldown on the target creature by the amount purchased. If that target creature has no active cooldowns, this effect does nothing.
xpCost: 80 xp per round of CD reduced

name: Delayed Effect
description: Effect takes time before it actually activates
xpCost: -50 xp per round up to 5 rounds

name: Delayed Effect: Highlighted
description:
Requires Delayed Effect  of at least 1 round. When used, the ability creates some clear warning indicating roughly when and where the the delayed effect will take place. 
For example, creating a highlighted circle on the ground for an AoE, or a timer indicating how many rounds until a creature will take massive damage.

name: Handedness
description:
How many hands are required to use this ability.
In short-hand, Handedness(1) refers to requiring 1 hand, and Handedness(2) requires 2.
xpCost:
No hands required 0xp
Takes up a hand -20xp
Takes up 2 hands -40xp
Requires more than 2 hands -80 xp

name: Interrupt
description: Ability may be used at any point during combat, including interrupting an enemy creature’s actions.

name: Lengthy Cast Time
description:
The Ability takes a number of minutes to complete, making it unfeasible to use in combat situations.
If this is put on a Duration: Extended you no longer halve flaws on the abilty.
xpCost:
-10 xp for 10 minutes
-30 xp for 30 minutes
-50 xp for 1 hour
-100 xp for 8 hours

name: Movement: Requires Movement
description: This ability may only be activated after you have used a movement action this turn.

name: Reaction
description: When chosen, specify a condition. When that condition is met this Ability may be used outside of normal turn order by spending the Ability’s AP cost without going into negative AP.

name: Reaction only
description: Requires Reaction . Can only use this ability when reaction trigger is met, unusable at will.

name: Reaction: Automatic
description:
Requires Reaction 
This ability always triggers when the reaction condition is met, even if you wouldn’t normally be able to react (unaware, unconscious). You still must meet all conditions and pay any costs (ap, class resources etc)

name: Reaction: Lightning
description: Requires Reaction and Reaction: Quick . Allows going into negative AP to ensure ability activation when a reaction trigger is met. Can continously be used whenever the reaction trigger is met, even while AP is currently negative, allowing the character to go even more negative on AP.

name: Reaction: Quick
description: Requires Reaction . Allows going into negative AP to ensure ability activation when a reaction trigger is met. Cannot be used again while already below 0 AP.

name: Requires: End of Turn
description: This ability may only be used as the last ability on your turn, and may not be used as a reaction or tag-team ability.

name: Requires: Start of Turn
description: This ability may only be used as the first ability on your turn, and may not be used as a reaction or tag-team ability.

name: Sub Effect
description:
Used as an organizational effect. Extras and flaws attached to a sub effect only affect that sub effect, and do not affect any other effects, extras, or flaws attached to the parent ability. 
The cost of a sub effect is the final calculated ability cost of everything attached to the sub effect, and then applied to the parent ability as a flat xp, minimum 10. 
Please see Sub Effects
xpCost: Costs the final calculated XP value of everything on the sub effect, minimum 10

name: Sub Effect: Flaws Only
description: Same as Sub Effect, but can only have flaws and modifiers.
xpCost: Costs the final calculated XP value of everything on the sub effect, can be negative

name: Object
description:
This effect is automatically applied to objects bought with currency as a 0 xp effect. 
Converts the ability into an object with an HP of 10, DR (all) of 10 and size 0. The shape and type of object is set when this effect is purchased, and has no inherent mechanical effects without any being purchased and attached to this effect.
If the object is destroyed it can be restored for or repaired by any means reasonable for the type of object. If the object is lost or consumed and purchased with XP, it can be replaced for free by spending a long rest to replace it. 
You cannot create currency via this means.
Handedness is recommended, as most objects normally require a free hand.
xpCost:
0 xp for anything purchased with currency
-30 xp (base) for an object that has no hand requirement
-50 xp for an object that requires a free hand to operate (Handedness(1) included)
-70 xp for an object with Handedness(2)

name: Object: Attunement Slot Required
description:
Requires Object 
This Item requires using an attunement slot to be equipped

name: Object: Contact Damage
description:
The object deals damage inherently to any creature that comes into contact with it. 
The object deals this damage at the start of each turn a creature is in contact, or immediately when new contact is made.
If the object is of a large enough size that occupies multiple squares, moving from one square into another is considered making a new contact and deals damage.
This extra can also be used as a flaw depending on circumstances. 
This is useful for electrified items, pools of lava or acid, or fields of caltrops.

name: Object: Detachable
description:
When this object would be affected by Damage, it may instead be removed from your character and moved into an adjacent square to reduce the points of damage by half, rounded down.
Any appropriate AP must be spent to collect and re-equip the object.

name: Object: Dual-wieldable
description: When the character has equipped this item in their off-hand, it is capable of using dual-wielding rules

name: Object: Durability
description: Increases the HP of an object.

name: Object: Fragile
description: The object is particularly susceptible to damage of any kind. Reduce the object's HP to 5 and damage resistances all to 0.

name: Object: Hardened Structure
description:
Requires an object that is a structure or vehicle.
Adds points of Damage Resist (All) to a structure or vehicle making it harder for normal creatures and weapons to damage it.
All objects begin with DR(All) of 10.

name: Object: Heavy Equipment
description: Requires Object. Makes an object unable to be easily moved. The object may only be activated when stationary.

name: Object: Incredible Durability
description:
Requires Object.
Item cannot be destroyed by HP damage or reduced in effect by damage or Sunder effects.
However, you must choose a single damage type (besides True Damage) the object is NOT immune to.

name: Object: Indestructible
description:
Requires Object.
Item cannot be destroyed by HP damage or reduced in effect by damage or Sunder effects.
However, you must choose some way that the item may still be destroyed.

name: Object: Intangible
description: Converts an object to be intangible, allowing creatures to pass through the space it occupies regardless of its size category.

name: Object: Quick Draw
description: When this item is drawn or stowed, it may be done as a 0 AP action, instead of a 1 AP action.

name: Object: Quick Replace
description: When a non-summoned object is destroyed or lost, it can be replaced on a short rest instead of a long rest.

name: Object: Refreshable
description: Requires Limited Uses (Consumables)  purchased with gold. Charges refresh on long rest

name: Object: Secured
description:
Requires an Object that makes sense to be vulnerable to disarment.
Item cannot be disarmed, or otherwise forcibly removed from the character without more extreme circumstances.

name: Object: Special Ammo
description:
Converts the ability into 'unit' of ammunition for a given weapon type as appropriate for that weapon (ex, a bullet for a gun, an arrow for a bow).
This ability triggers when the ammo is used and then is consumed.This ability uses the range of the given weapon and the AP of either the Special Ammo or the Weapon, whichever is higher.

name: Object: Structure
description:
Requires Object.
Makes the object craft more slowly (10 gold per success per day of work instead of 50), and the object may no longer be moved by any but exceptional means.

name: Object: Structure - Room Buff
description:
Requires Object: Structure .
Staying in or otherwise properly utilizing this room provides a buff to the occupant for a certain number of days.
Continuous use of the room refreshes the buff's duration.

name: Object: Summoned
description:
Converts the objects from a permanent object into a summoned object that can be conjured using AP. By default, only a single summoned object may exist at one time, or a small number of tiny/simple objects with GM permission (such as ball bearings or darts).
You can create currency via this means, but it disappears like all other objects when the effect ends.

name: Object: Summoned Quantity
description: Increases the number of summoned objects that can exist simultaneously.

name: Object: Thrown
description: When this ability is activated, the character throws the object and may not use it again without another object or retrieving it.

name: Object: Wall
description:
Requires Object: Structure .
The volumetric area the structure occupies may be rearranged into a wall shape that occupies the same volume of space.
Bring a calculator.

name: Duration: Channeled
description: You must spend CR each round to maintain this duration effect.
xpCost:
-25% multiplier upcharges per CR
-50% for Class Resource: Draining Pool or Class Resource: Special Resources

name: Duration: Charges - Instant Effects
description:
This is the version to use when all effects are Instant
Each “charge” allows the effects of the ability to be used once when it would apply. Multiple charges can be used in a single turn.
The effect is considered dispellable while any charges remain, and any remaining charges are lost at the end of an encounter. When this is cast on a target with remaining charges, the number is reset to the original number of charges.

name: Duration: Charges - Lingering
description:
Instead of charges being lost at the end of the encounter, you can have them last for 1 day, or until all charges have been used.
If the charges last until used, all discounts are reduced by half, like Duration: Extended

name: Duration: Charges - Round Based
description:
Requires at least one 1 Round duration effect or one Passive effect with Duration: Non-passive applied. The ability must still be round based
The number of rounds the ability would have lasted are converted to charges. Each charge allows the effects of the ability to be used once when it would apply.
The effect is considered dispellable while any charges remain, and any remaining charges are lost at the end of an encounter. When this is cast on a target with remaining charges, the number is reset to the original number of charges.
If this ability has any Instant effects, you must also apply Duration: Constantly Repeating Effect
tags: Duration, Buff, Debuff, Limited Use, Flaw

name: Duration: Committed Resources
description:
Requires another Duration effect that causes the ability to last longer than 1 round and a class resource cost for activation.
When this ability is activated your maximum class resource pool is reduced by the class resource cost of this ability until this ability's duration ends. When the duration effect ends your max pool returns to normal.
This flaw is not selectable if you have no inherent means beyond resting to restore class resources.
If this ability has a channeled resource cost, they may also reduce your maximum pool when consumed to further refund additional xp. Ex: Each round your maximum CR reduces
xpCost:
-10% xp per CR for base flaw
-5% additional xp for channeled durations

name: Duration: Concentration
description:
When taking damage, must pass a Concentration (RES) save check of DC 1+Number of Damage Dice used in the attacking ability. If the save is failed, the ability is dispelled.
When maintaining this ability for extended durations, the GM may ask you to make Concentration (RES) saves to keep it going (for example, a DC2 save every 30 minutes)

name: Duration: Conditional
description:
Requires a Duration. 
The duration on this ability may only remain so long as the condition chosen when this flaw is purchased is true. If the condition becomes false at any time, the duration ends early and immediately. 
The false condition must be reasonably able to occur during normal circumstances of this ability's use for this flaw to be valid.
Ex: "If all nine planets are perfectly aligned" is not a valid condition to cancel your effects.
xpCost: -10% to -100% from the multiplier upcharges (can't reduce below 0).

name: Duration: Constant Backfire
description:
Requires Backfire Damage 
Backfire damage is dealt every turn this ability is active instead of just on activation

name: Duration: Constantly Repeating Effect
description: Instant effects become effects that are constantly active and repeat themselves over and over beyond even reactions. This modifier needs GM approval (e.g. constant Dispel is fine, constant Damage Negate All is not, constant Damage doesn't even make sense unless there’s a conditional modifier)

name: Duration: Dispel Immune
description: Ability cannot be dispelled.

name: Duration: Encounter
description: Convert Instant and 1 round effects to last until the end of the current encounter / scene. Instant effects can be triggered once on each of your turns.

name: Duration: Exclusive
description:
Requires at least one other ability with this modifier, not in an array with this ability
Only one ability with this modifier may be active at a time.

name: Duration: Extended
description:
Ability lasts until dispelled, cancelled, or the death of you or the target. All flaws and discounts are reduced by half. If you add both Duration: Dispel Immune and Duration: Persists on Caster Death you must add some other end condition.
Instant effects can be triggered once on each of your turns.

name: Duration: Full Concentration
description:
Requires Duration: Concentration 
While this concentration effect is maintained, you can take no other actions except to continue the effect or end the effect.

name: Duration: Interruptible
description: An enemy within reach of the target can spend 3 AP to end this effect with no check

name: Duration: Non-passive
description: Convert a passive duration to 1 round duration that can be dispelled. Duration can be extended with more rounds/maintained as normal for 1 round abilities
xpCost: Effect only costs 25% of the passive

name: Duration: Overclocked
description:
Requires a duration.
Causes the attached duration effect to trigger at the start of every turn in the initiative order instead of on only one turn per round.

name: Duration: Passive
description: Ability lasts forever. Only affects you but cannot be dispelled, and does not need to be recast if you die and revive. Activation flaws cannot be added.

name: Duration: Persists on Caster Death
description: The ability does not end on your death

name: Duration: Repeatable Saves
description:
Requires Target: Save  or Target: Save - Resistable . 
Whenever the target is negatively affected by the effect they initially failed a save against, they may attempt the save again and end the effect if they succeed.
These additional saves occur once per time period purchased (Round, Hour, Day)
xpCost:
-100% multiplier upcharges for 1 round
-50% multiplier upcharges for 1 Hour
-20% multiplier upcharges for 1 day

name: Duration: Rounds
description: Convert Instant and 1 round effects to a longer duration. Instant effects can be triggered once on each of your turns, and have a starting value of 0 rounds
tags: Duration, Buff, Debuff, Class Resource, Dice Roll, Successes

name: Duration: Single Instance
description:
Requires an ability that can be cast multiple times during its duration (i.e a 3 round duration with 3 round cooldown doesn’t count).
Only one instance of this ability can be active at one time.

name: Duration: Skillful Start
description: When you make a skill check to begin a duration effect you may spend additional successes from that check to add additional rounds of duration that begin when the effect would normally end. Adds 1 round per additional success.

name: Duration: Stackable
description: Requires a buff effect. When you cast this ability on a target that already has the buff, you can stack the effect once per round. Treat all instances as if they were one for dispel, channeled etc

name: Duration: Sustained
description: You must spend AP each round to maintain this duration effect.

name: Duration: Until Rest / 24hr
description:
Requires Duration: Encounter
The effect with this duration goes away when the character rests or 24hrs have passed which ever comes first.

name: Duration: While Conscious
description: Ability ends when you lose consciousness or go to sleep.

name: Passive: Dispellable
description:
This passive or permanent ability is now vulnerable to being dispelled by other creatures. Once dispelled, it must be re-applied as a 3 AP self-only ability.
The AP cost or refund of reapplying the passive may be adjusted, with them being adjusted to half the xp value of a normal AP cost effect.

name: Range Limit: End
description:
Requires Range Limit: Suspend 
The ability ends instead

name: Range Limit: Suspend
description:
Requires Range or Area of Effect that targets creatures
When the target leaves the range of the ability, the ability has no effect until the target re-enters the range

name: Additional Resource Pool
description: Create a secondary Class Resource for a class that can be drawn from separately from your first, max value is set to 3 by default.

name: Armor: Quick Change
description: When equipping or unequipping armor or shields, you may spend 1 less AP than the item normally requires.

name: Armor: Soak / Damage Reduction (DR)
description: Reduce the damage you take from attacks with a specific type.
xpCost:
20xp per type DR
60xp per group DR
180xp per all DR

name: Body: Extra Limb
description: Character has a fully functional extra limb, can be arm, leg, prehensile tail. Anything a limb can normally do the extra limb can do as well.

name: Breakthrough: Add
description: Increase the Character's Breakthrough stat.
xpCost: 60 xp per point, increasing by 60 xp for each purchase

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Postpone Death
description: When you would be incapacitated or killed, you may spend a breakthrough point to delay this outcome for 1 round.

name: Breakthrough: Limit Break - Unflawed
description: When using breakthrough points to remove a flaw from a single use of an ability, the character may elect to spend an additional breakthrough point to remove ALL flaws from that ability for that ability use instead.
tags: Breakthrough, Buff, Self, Status, GM Approval

name: Breakthrough: Smash your Fate
description: You may use breakthrough points to cancel the negative effects of a Critical Failure, or to downgrade a Catastrophic Failure into a Critical Failure.

name: Breakthrough: Unbreakable
description: Your breakthrough points may now restore on short rests.
xpCost: 50 xp per breakthrough restored on short rest

name: Breakthrough: Unchained
description: Your breakthrough points now restore on long rest instead of per session.

name: Bulky
description: This creature or object is large and bulky. Creatures of the same size or smaller may use it as cover or hide behind it for stealth rolls.

name: CHAR +1
description: Add an additional point to a characteristic. You must purchase each rank in sequence (ex: you cannot buy 2 in STR if you have 0 in STR)
xpCost: 200 xp * the number you are raising the CHAR to, awarding a 20% discount to primary characteristics

name: Class Resource: Combat Pool
description:
The attached class resource pool cannot benefit from any effects that restore class resources, and any class resources that would be restored to it are wasted.
However, the class resource pool instantly refills to full at the end of each combat encounter/scene instead of on short/long rests.
tags: Class Resource, Modifier, Self, Limited Use, Flaw

name: Class Resource: Daily Pool
description:
The attached class resource pool cannot benefit from any effects that restore class resources, and any class resources that would be restored to it are wasted.
Class resource points in this pool may ONLY be restored by taking a long rest.
tags: Class Resource, Modifier, Flaw, Self, Limited Use

name: Class Resource: Draining Pool
description:
The attached class resource pool defaults to empty instead of full. Whenever you take a rest of any significant length you lose all class resources. 
Increases the discount earned for each point of class resource attached to an ability.
xpCost:
Increases the discount per point of resource consumed from -50 to -100
Additionally doubles the size of your resource pool
tags: Class Resource, Flaw, Debuff, Self, Limit

name: Class Resource: Increase
description: Increase a class resource pool's maximum size

name: Class Resource: Leaking Pool
description: The attached class resource pool does not replenish when taking a Rest. Whenever you take a rest of any significant length you instead lose some amount of class resources.
xpCost: -50 xp per CR lost when resting
tags: Class Resource, Flaw, Debuff, Self, Limit

name: Class Resource: Overcharge
description: When restoring resource points, if the amount of resource points restored is more than your maximum resource amount, the extra resource points above your max are converted to temporary resource points instead of being wasted. This effect may only trigger when at or below maximum resource points.

name: Class Resource: Special Resources
description:
Requires Class Resource: Stagnant Pool or Leaking Pool.
The attached class resource pool cannot have class resources restored to it that don't fit the aesthetic of the class and pool type. The class resource must also be specific, aka not just 'mana' or 'focus'.
Your character may only replenish this pool by completing certain approperiate roleplay actions, and not via abilities with restore Class Resource effects.
For example, a necromancer using 'Bones' as their class resource pool may not restore class resources by drinking a mana potion, instead they must actually collect bones from corpses.
xpCost: Increases the discount per point of resource consumed from -50 to -100
tags: Class Resource, Modifier, Flaw, Self, Limit, GM Approval

name: Class Resource: Stagnant Pool
description: The attached class resource pool does not recover when the character rests. The resource pool only increases when actions are completed that recover resource points
tags: Class Resource, Flaw, Debuff, Self, Limit

name: Class Resource: Successful Recharge
description: Whenever your character makes a successful combat check of any kind during a combat encounter, they may spend 1 success to restore 1 Class Resource.

name: Crafting: Efficient Craftsman
description: Whenever your character crafts an item, they increase the amount of gold put down towards the item's completion per success in their check, allowing the item to be crafted in fewer checks overall.
xpCost: 10 xp per additional 1 gold obtained per success on crafting checks

name: Crafting: Junksmith
description:
You may use any material even relatively close to the needed material type instead of gold when crafting. Each 'Unit' of junk you collect is considered worth 20 gold that may only be used towards crafting.
Any items crafted using this effect permanently gain the [Critical Flaw] flaw without its associated discounts, destroying itself when the flaw is triggered. The [Critical Flaw] may be removed by spending the appropriate amount of gold to refit the item with proper parts.

name: Crafting: Materials Gathering
description: Your character may passively gather crafting materials over time to reduce the cost of building items. You may gather 5 gold worth of materials per in-game day provided you had at least some time to do so. These resources may only be used to craft items.
xpCost:
75 xp per 5 gold of proper materials per day
15 xp per 5 gold of Junk materials per day (see Wealth: Junksmith)

name: Crafting: Quick Craftsman
description: Reduce the time required to make a crafting check.
xpCost: 50 xp per 10% time decrease. Minimum 10% time

name: Death: Revenant
description:
At the start of your turn and if you are dead, return from death all by your goddamned self. Return to 1 HP and 0 AP. You have any resource points that you had when you died.
You do not restore lost limbs and similar, but do regenerate enough so as to not be in any immediate danger of death (other than by other creature's actions).

name: Defense: Critical Resistance
description: Whenever the creature is struck by a critical hit, reduce the multiplier value of that critical hit by 1, to a minimum of 1.

name: Environmental Weakness
description:
Your character is actively averse to a certain environmental effect such as sunlight, silver, rain, flowers, etc.
If the weakness you possess is very rare, the GM may elect to reduce the values of this flaw.
If Aversion, your character simply hates it on a roleplay level and wishes to avoid it.
If Allergic, your character gains Sickened(1) when in contact. 
If Harmful, your character gains Exhausted when in contact and takes 1 True Damage each round.
If Deadly, your character gains all the above and takes 20 True Damage each round.
xpCost:
Aversion: -30 xp
Allergic: -50 xp
Harmful: -80 xp
Deadly: -200 xp

name: Fitness: Throwing Practice
description:
Whenever you throw an object, multiply the number of squares you may throw it by 2.
You may now throw grappled creatures half this distance instead of only 1 square.
Increase the multiplier for this effect by 1 for each purchase.

name: Health: Increase
description: Increases a character's maximum HP.
xpCost:
5 xp per 1 HP
This increases in cost by 5 xp for each purchase.
Formula: 5(n*(n+1)/2)

name: Initiative: decrease
description: Whenever your character makes an initiative roll, decrease that value
xpCost:
-30 xp per decrease * the number of increases you've purchased
You may not decrease your initiative below your SPD.
For example, -2 Initiative refunds -90 xp (-30 + -60)

name: Initiative: Flexible Initiative
description: If you have lowered your initiative from the rolled value, you may reclaim your original initiative value once per encounter per purchase of this passive.

name: Initiative: Increase
description: Whenever your character makes an initiative roll, increase that value
xpCost:
30 xp * the number of increases you've purchased
For example, +2 Initiative costs 90 xp (30 + 60)

name: Luck: Favored of Fate
description: Your Fate Die now considers a 5 to be a 6 on the roll.
tags: Luck, Dice Roll, Critical, Passive, Buff, Self

name: Luck: Foes
description: Your Luck rerolls obtained from your Luck characteristic may now also be used to re-roll the dice of your enemies so long as they are in sight of you

name: Luck: Fortunate
description: Your Luck ReRolls restore on long rests instead of per session

name: Luck: Friends
description: Your Luck rerolls obtained from your Luck characteristic may now also be used to re-roll the dice of your allies so long as they are in sight of you

name: Luck: Gambler of Fate
description: Requires Luck: Fortunate . You may regain Luck ReRolls on short rests
xpCost: 50 xp per reroll restored on short rest

name: Luck: Ill-Fated
description: Rolls of a 2 on your fate die also trigger any effects that would occur when it rolled a 1.

name: Luck: Loved by Luck
description: You may add 1/2 your LCK to the value of your fate die for determining advantage effects.

name: Luck: Nothing to Chance
description: Your fate die may no longer provide negative or positive effects.

name: Mounts: Jousting
description: When dealing melee damage while riding a mount, add the mount's Fitness as bonus damage to the melee attack.

name: Mounts: Let's Ride
description: Mounting or dismounting is now a 1 AP action instead of a 3 AP action.

name: Mounts: Synergistic Attack
description:
When you make a successful attack roll while mounted, if your mount also has an attack that can strike the same target, your mount may automatically succeed and deal damage to that target and both attacks are combined for purposes of overcoming damage resistance. 
Your mount must still consume its normal AP and fulfill any normal conditions to use this effect.

name: Movement Type: Add CHAR
description: Add additional squares of movement to a movement type based on a chosen CHAR. Each movement type can only have one CHAR added to it at a time (land speed can have an additional beyond the base FIT). Add double the CHAR to the movement speed.
xpCost: 3x XP of a single square of that movement type

name: Movement: Burrowing
description: Increase burrow speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. You can only burrow through terrain (ie no HP on the thing you're burrowing through)

name: Movement: Flying
description: Increase fly speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting.

name: Movement: Gliding
description: Increase glide speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. You may move down or horizontally with this speed. While gliding you fall 5 squares per round.

name: Movement: Hover Max Height
description: The default height for hover is a couple inches from the ground (i.e. still in the same square as if standing). This extra increases the maximum height at which you can hover. When you would take falling damage, you may reduce the fallen distance by this amount.

name: Movement: Hover Speed
description: Increase hover speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. By default you only hover a couple inches above the surface.

name: Movement: Ignore Terrain Difficulty
description:
Choose a type of terrain, when trying to move or act within that type of terrain you are no longer required to make movement checks or reduce your movement speed because of environmental hazards of that terrain type.
For example, if you choose thick foliage you no longer treat it as difficult terrain and move at normal speed, and may also climb normal trees without making a climb check. 
Example terrain types: thick foliage, icy terrain, tight-ropes, narrow spaces, loose scattered debris fields, etc.
xpCost:
30 xp per terrain type
150 xp for all terrain types

name: Movement: Jump
description: Increase jump distance by 1 square. This movement type does not allow Sprinting. When using Jump movement, each AP spent lets you travel up to that many squares in a straight line, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. You must land on the ground before you can jump again

name: Movement: Land Speed
description: Increase land speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting

name: Movement: Push Resist
description: When you would be pushed, reduce the distance by a number of squares.

name: Movement: Spider Climbing
description: Increase climb speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. While using this movement you can freely move on walls and ceilings as well as the ground.

name: Movement: Swim Speed
description: Increase swim speed by 1 square. This movement type allows Sprinting. This does not give you the ability to breath underwater or anything

name: Movement: Teleport
description: Increase teleport speed by 1 square. This movement type does not allow Sprinting. Without Target: Location Targeted / Sightless, you cannot teleport through walls. You do count as moving from your space for reactions with that trigger. Movement debuffs do affect this movement.

name: ReRolls: Add
description: Increase the Character's ReRoll stat.

name: Saves: Boost
description: Choose a single specific save your character may make such as poison, sleep, concentration, etc and add additional dice to the pool you roll when you make that type of save.

name: Saves: Weaken
description:
Choose a single specific save your character may make such as poison, sleep, concentration, etc and remove dice from the pool you roll when you make that type of save.
You may not remove more dice from that type of save than you have in the corresponding characteristic.

name: Senses: Add
description: Adds a passive extra sense to your character. This sense is either blocked by obstacles or has a radius of 20*CUN in feet (4*CUN in squares). Example senses are Nightvision, Enhanced Scent (for tracking and identifying by scent etc), Binocular Vision, XRay Vision (Price is per square of obstruction you can see through), See Invisible, Tremorsense, Life Sense, Mind Sense

name: Size Category: Decrease
description:
Decreases the size category of the creature or object by one category.
This effect only affects the amount of space the target occupies and has no other mechanical effect.
Creatures of size 0 or smaller may occupy the same square as other creatures. Medium creatures are considered Size 1.

name: Size Category: Increase
description:
Increases the size category of the creature or object by one category.
This effect only affects the amount of space the creature occupies and has no other mechanical effect.
Creatures occupy space of a cube with sides equal to their size with medium creatures being Size 1.
Therefore, a Size 2 creature occupies a 2x2 square of space, and Size 3 a 3x3 square.

name: Skill Dice
description:
Effects of this ability only apply to a certain skill, not to the entire characteristic.
For example: extra dice to Fitness rolls, but only when running, not when lifting objects.

If the skill chosen is particularly specific (ie: flower arrangement, knitting, etc), with GM approval you may purchase skill dice for that skill at 30 xp per die without the normal increasing costs.
xpCost:
50xp x the number of dice will have applied to this skill for each additional die.
For example, +1 die is 50xp, +2 dice is 150 xp (50 + 100), and +3 is 300 xp (50 + 100 + 150)

name: Skill Dice: Unskilled
description:
Remove dice from your dice pool when rolling a specific skill, rather than everything for a characteristic.
The skill must be one of perception, athletics, stealth, a social skill, or a class skill

name: Skill: Power Gauge
description: When you make an opposed skill check, your character knows by how much they succeeded or failed the opposed the check and how many dice the opponent rolled for the check.

name: Social: Attractive
description: Whenever your character attempts a social check with a creature who finds them within their preferences, you may add 1 success to the check.

name: Social: Bonus SR
description: Increase your character's starting SR for Social Combat (see Social Combat rules)

name: Social: Favored
description: Your character has earned the trust/love/loyalty/etc of a particular individual, group, or faction. So long as you do not abuse this favor, the specified target will aid you to the best of their ability within reason.
xpCost: variable (depending on the number and ability of the individuals)

name: Social: Forgettable
description: Your character's words or deeds are less likely to spread within the general knowledge of a populace, and are more easily forgotten

name: Social: Hated
description:
Your character has earned the hatred of a particular individual, group, or faction. Whenever this group is in any way involved they will do their utmost within their ability and character to destroy or punish you.
This flaw is not obtainable if the specified group chosen is not able to influence the story.
xpCost: variable (depending on the number and threat of the individuals)

name: Social: Heroic Bias
description: Your character's words and deeds are more likely to be taken positively by the general populace

name: Social: Infamous Bias
description: Your character's words and deeds are more likely to invoke fear and apprehension in the general populace

name: Social: Lasting Impression
description: Whenever you make a significant impression on a character, they are vastly less likely to change their opinion of you, even when presented contrary evidence

name: Social: Liked Associates
description: When your character becomes liked more by other characters, other characters in your party also become liked more by their association with you.

name: Social: Money Talks
description: Whenever your character attempts a social check and fails, they may spend 25 gold per die to reroll results

name: Social: Pendantic
description: When making social combat attack rolls, you may also add your INT dice to your normal dice pool for determining number of successes. However, usage of this effect may cause other characters involved in the situation to find you generally more annoying or insufferable, lowering their opinion of you, depending on their personality.

name: Social: Popular
description: Your character's words or deeds are more likely to spread within the general knowledge of a populace and be remembered for longer

name: Social: Public Speaking
description: Whenever you speak to a crowd your social checks affect more targets and more strongly at GM's discretion.

name: Social: Reputation
description:
Any NPC that recognizes or knows your character also knows an established fact about them, even if you haven't met before. You may lose this reputation if you repeatedly and publicly act against it.
Examples: You are a fair merchant, you will kill those that oppose you, you absolutely love cheeses

name: Social: Scathing Remark
description: When succeeding a Social Combat check that insults or taunts the opponent, you may deal your CUN in additional SR but significantly lower your opponent's disposition towards you. You may only do this once per Social Combat encounter.

name: Social: Silver Tongue
description: When you succeed a Social Combat check, each bonus success reduces your opponent's SR by 2 instead of by 1.

name: Social: Stubborn
description: Reduce the amount of SR damage you take in Social Combat
xpCost: 30 xp per point of SR reduction

name: Speed: Overhasten
description: When a haste effect would raise your AP over the maximum size of your AP pool, the additional AP is not lost and is instead retained as temporary AP points. This effect may only trigger when your AP pool is below its maximum.

name: Spite: Nobody Wins
description:
When making an opposed skill check against another creature, if you lose the skill check you may apply a catastrophic failure to yourself in order to apply a critical failure to the creature that won the opposed check.
You may only use this effect once per game session.
tags: Dice Roll, Self, Critical, Limited Use

name: Stealth: Observant
description: Treat your passive perception radius as 1 square radius larger per purchase

name: Stealth: Sneaking
description: Treat the passive perception radius of other creatures as 1 square smaller per purchase.

name: Swift Hands
description: Character may perform one minor action per turn for 0 AP instead of the normal 1 AP.

name: Unimpeded Grapple
description: You may now sprint when grappling a creature.

name: Utility: AP Transfer - Overdraw
description: Requires Utility: AP Transfer . When you transfer AP to an ally, you may now go into negative AP, up to a maximum of negative your AP generation rate.

name: Utility: AP Transfer - Overhaste
description: Requires Utility: AP Transfer . When you transfer AP to an ally, you may transfer them more AP than their normal maximum. The extra AP remains as temporary AP until the end of their next turn.

name: Utility: Breathless
description: You do not need to breath.

name: Utility: Hungerless
description: You do not need to eat or drink to survive.

name: Utility: Relentless
description: You do not get exhausted and do not reed to rest.

name: Utility: Tireless
description: Last twice as long without needing to make exhaustion checks when doing strenuous or long physical activity and gain 1 free success on saves vs exhaustion.

name: Utility: Water Breathing
description: Your character can breath underwater without sufficating.

name: Wealth: Disciple
description:
This effect can only be purchased using XP.
After purchasing this passive any training undergone by this character using currency has a percentage discount to the amount of currency required to receive the training. Reducing the cost from the default of 200% down to a minimum of 100%.
xpCost:
50 xp per 20% discount
Increases in cost by 50 xp each time it is purchased
Cannot lower cost below 100%.

name: Wealth: Investment Purchase
description:
Must be purchased as an item.
Once per month make a LCK+(INT or CUN) roll and subtract 5, then multiply the result by the gold value purchased for your change in wealth.
World events may alter the DC or value.

name: Wealth: Investments
description: Your character due to sound investments, a trust fund, patent or some other form of passive income makes gold each day. You generate 5 gold a day with this effect. It may be purchased multiple times. You cannot purchase this with Gold, use Investment Purchase instead.
xpCost: 100 xp per 5 gold of income per day.

name: Wealth: Merchant
description: Whenever your character attempts to sell an item for gold to an NPC, they gain an additional percentage of the item's sale value in bonus gold.
xpCost:
50 xp per 5% bonus gold value.
Maximum 100% sale value.

name: Weight: Denser
description: Your character is heavier than an average creature of their size, including with it everything that would be expected as a result.
xpCost:
30 xp - heavy
50 xp - very heavy
80 xp - Extremely heavy

name: Weight: Lighter
description: Your character is lighter than an average creature of their size, including with it everything that would be expected as a result.
xpCost:
30 xp - light
50 xp - very light
80 xp - Extremely light

name: Absorb Appearance
description:
Absorb the appearance of another creature or object and store it in your character's memory, allowing it to be used with any utility effect that requires knowing something else's apperance. 
When absorbing the appearance of an unwilling creature, make an attack roll.
Works well with Utility: Disguise.

name: Absorb Element: Damage Type
description:
Draw power from an elemental source in the world and set the damage type of all abilities with the "Alternate Damage Type: Absorbed" modifier to that damage type.
This damage type remains until overwritten unless a limited duration modifier is applied to this effect.
For example, fire damage from a campfire or ice damage from snow.
In combat, this is a 1 AP action.
tags: Absorb, Damage Type, Buff, Combat, Self

name: Absorb Element: Heal
description:
Draw power from an elemental source in the world and restore HP depending on the power and quantity of that source. Determine the applicable sources appropriate when this ability is first purchased. 
For example, a pyromancer may draw 5 HP from a campfire, or any number of HP from a lava flow within an active volcano.
In combat, this is a 1 AP action.

name: Absorb Element: Recharge
description:
Draw power from an elemental source in the world and restore class resources depending on the power and quantity of that source. Determine the applicable sources appropriate when this ability is first purchased. 
For example, a pyromancer may draw 1 point from a campfire, or any number of points from a lava flow within an active volcano.
In combat, this is a 1 AP action.

name: Absorb Personality
description: Absorb the personality of a target so you can impersonate them later

name: Absorb: Knowledge
description:
Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses or Utility: Telepathy.
Make an opposed INT check against the creature's INT CHAR while consuming its corpse or connected to its mind, if successful, absorb some of its memories chosen by the GM.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability
description:
When your character is afflicted by an enemy ability, consumes a signficant part of that creature, or otherwise absorbs from it in some meaningful way, you may make an opposed check based on the characteristic of the enemy's ability as a 0 AP reaction.
