If successful,  gain use of that enemy's ability for one round. This ability still must be activated using its normal activation conditions.
You still take the normal damage or other effects from any abilties you attempt to mimic.

name: Alter State
description:
When using this ability, alter the state of the attached creature or object to a new defined state (such as changing combat stance, shapeshifting, or transforming a weapon). 
Any ability that requires this state may use XP up to the amount spent on this effect without additional cost (if 300 xp is spent to transform into bear form, any abilities that require bear form up to 300 xp have no cost).
Discounts applied to this ability do not reduce the XP available to the abilities that require the altered state. Continung the above example, if the 300 xp were discounted to 50 xp by flaws, 300 xp is still available for purchasing abilities that require this state.  
By default, changing the state lasts until the end of the encounter and costs 3 AP to alter state.

name: Bestow Ability
description:
Choose a separate ability. When you activate this ability you choose a creature within range and bestow them use of the attached ability while this ability lasts.
You do not need to own the selected ability, but if you don’t already own it, you only have access to it if you bestow it upon yourself

name: Buff: Remove Flaw
description:
Choose a specific flaw when this effect is first purchased. Whenever this buff is applied, it removes the requirement on the target that the flaw be satisfied. 
This buff effect cannot have a duration of Encounter or any other longer duration.

name: Class Resource: Buff Pool
description:
Temporarily raise the maximum amount of resource you may store, does not grant any points of class resource in itself.
The duration may not be upgraded to passive or continuous.

name: Class Resource: Burn
description: Remove points from an enemy's resource pool after a successful attack

name: Class Resource: Burn Pool
description: After a successful attack, reduce the maximum number of points in an enemy's resource pool, burning any points that no longer fit

name: Class Resource: Drain
description: Remove points from an enemy’s resource pool and gain a number equal to what was removed. The conversion should make sense, for example, you can’t drain “scrap” to refill “blood”, but you can do things like drain “stamina” to refill “mana” etc.

name: Crafting: Instant Crafting - Consumable
description: When this ability activates, instantly create a consumable object up to this effect's gold value that your character knows to make and consume that amount of gold.

name: Crafting: Instant Crafting - Equipment
description: When this ability activates, instantly create a non-consumable object up to this effect's gold value that your character knows to make and consume that amount of gold.

name: Critical: Ravenous
description: Bestow a buff effect that while in effect causes all hits made by the target character to upgrade into critical hits.

name: Damage: Convert Damage Type
description: Applies a buff that converts all damage done by the character to the damage type chosen when this extra is purchased. Can only be used on allies.

name: Equipment: Banish
description: While this ability is active, the targets equipment is banished. The target cannot use active abilities from equipment, but benefits from any ongoing effects.

name: Equipment: Disable
description: While this ability is active, the target cannot benefit from passive or active abilities from their equipment.

name: Erase Memory
description: Target forgets memories about a specific topic

name: Initiative: Offensive Decrease
description: Reduce the initiative of a target creature

name: Initiative: Tag Team (Command)
description:
Target an ally within range of this ability. That ally may immediately take an action before returning to your turn (provided you have any AP remaining).
The ally may refuse to take an action at no cost to themselves.

name: Possess
description: Enter and take control of another creature, like a ghost possession or parasite control. While inside the other creature, you do not have your own turn and instead control the target’s turn. The cheaper version only allows you to use the targets abilities and passives, but the more expensive version allows you to retain your passive bonuses and use your abilities as if the target was the caster. This effect can be removed by dispel or cleanse.
xpCost:
150 xp for target abilities only
250 xp to retain personal abilities

name: Read Memory
description: Read memories about a specific topic

name: Read Surface Thoughts
description: Read the current surface thoughts of a target

name: Soul Link: Health
description:
Choose a willing creature, for the duration of this effect you may elect to transfer up to the percentage bought of each HP damage you take to your soul-linked partner. You may choose which character's damage resist applies when the link is formed.
When a soul link is formed, choose the percent of the damage that will be redirected up to 100%.

name: Soul Link: Statuses
description:
Choose a willing creature, for the duration of this effect you may elect to transfer up to the number of statuses bought to your soul-linked partner, default 1. Ranked statuses are still considered 1 status regardless of their ranks for this effect.
Transferring statuses is by default a 3 AP action, any AP modification extra may be applied to it, with relevant multipliers applying to this ability in addition to any AP multipliers used for the action needed in creating the soul link.
Any statuses held by your partner when this effect ends are automatically returned to you.
xpCost: 30 xp per max status transferrable at once

name: Utility: Compel Truth
description: While under this effect, the target cannot convey a falsehood.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability - Corpses
description:
Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability . Allows you to absorb an ability using the corpse of a creature instead of being afflicted by their ability. Make an opposed check against the stat as though the creature was still alive.
Allows obtaining buff and heal abilities the creature would not normally use against an opponent. By default, one use of one ability may be gained per corpse.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability Greater
description: Requires  Absorb: Mimic Ability. When you absorb an enemy ability, you may now use that ability with the same conditions as the original creature until you take a long rest.

name: Absorb: Mimic Ability Perfected
description: Requires Absorb: Mimic Ability Greater . When you absorb an enemy ability then take a long rest you may ask the GM for the XP value of the absorbed ability and pay 80% of that cost to permanently obtain that ability.

name: Additional AP Cost
description: Ability costs more AP to activate than the Action Point Cost on the ability. Primarily intended to allow sub-effects that require additional AP to activate.

name: Apply Negative Status
description:
Using the ability applies a negative status effect to the user.
If any duration is attached, the status lasts until the end of the duration.
If no duration is attached, the effect remains until the END of the creature's next turn.
xpCost: Applies a discount equal to the XP cost of the status as seen in the Status Effects Table

name: Area of Effect: Growing
description: At the beginning of each round your AoE persists, it grows in radius by the amount specified by this extra.
xpCost: 3x the normal cost of the Range: Area Effect of choice

name: Area of Effect: Moving
description: Each round you may move the area of effect as a 0 ap action, except on the turn that the AoE was created.

name: Area of Effect: Shrinking
description:
Requires an AoE with duration.
At the beginning of each round your AoE persists, it shrinks in radius by the amount specified by this flaw to a minimum size of 1 square.
xpCost: 0.5x the normal cost of the Range: Area Effect extras attached to this ability

name: Area of Effect: Sticky
description: When applied to an ability with an area of effect and duration, the area may be targeted upon a creature or object instead of a point in the terrain. If that target moves, the area will remain around it.

name: Attack: Simplistic
description: When this ability activates, it doesn’t generate any additional successes. It only does its base effects and then ends.

name: Backfire Damage
description: Causes damage to yourself when used, not valid when damage resist entirely negates it or the ability heals yourself in any way. This Flaw no longer refunds XP if the average damage dealt by the Backfire would reduce the creature beyond 0 HP.
xpCost: Discount equal to the XP cost of the equivalent level of damage

name: Body: Limb Unusable
description:
When this ability is triggered, a chosen limb or other body part is rendered unusable for its duration. When the duration expires, the limb returns to normal use.
In most instances, this effect would render the chosen limb numb and limp.
xpCost:
-30 xp for minor body parts
-50 xp for limbs and major body parts

name: CHAR -1 Flaw
description: Remove points from a characteristic as part of a debuff effect. Cost assumes base characteristic is 3, and you cannot go negative (ie you can take this buff up to 3 times per char for 150, 100, and 50 xp each time)
xpCost: 200 xp * (the number you lower the CHAR to + 1)

name: Cleanse: Package Deal
description: If the ability has multiple status effects, you must have all the effects cleansed to end the ability. If you cleanse a single status in the ability, it is only cleansed for the cleanse’s duration or 1 round.

name: Cleanse: Uncleansable (Duration)
description: Requires a duration. A status effect with this effect attached cannot be removed by other abilities, only the expiration of the duration may remove it.

name: Critical Flaw
description: Whenever this ability rolls no natural successes and the fate die rolls a 1, this ability triggers a Catastrophic Failure appropriate to the nature of the ability and situation at hand.

name: Critical: Bloodlust
description: Whenever this ability gains enough successes to be able to critically hit, it must do so rather than apply other effects.

name: Critical: Deadly
description: Critical Hits made by this ability deal maximized damage

name: Critical: Honed
description: You require one less success to invoke a critical hit with this ability
xpCost:
100 xp to reduce from 4 to 3
200 xp to reduce from 3 to 2
400 xp to reduce from 2 to 1

name: Critical: Killing Power
description: Whenever you deal a critical hit with this ability, you can now choose to add flat damage modifiers (such as those from characteristics) to your damage result BEFORE multiplication instead of after.
xpCost: 100 xp and +100% increase (so just this effect is 200xp)

name: Critical: Lucky Shot
description: Whenever your fate die rolls a 6 or greater for this ability, if the roll was a success then it becomes upgraded to a critical success

name: Critical: Savage
description: Add extra damage dice when this attack gets a Critical Hit. These dice aren’t multiplied, just added as additional damage to a critical hit.
xpCost: 50% of the normal cost of the damage dice

name: Cursed Power
description:
When using this ability, the end results of the ability's use is always considered to be one threat level higher than whatever was normally determined.
Generally, this means something bad will always happen when this ability is used, or when something bad happens this effect makes it worse.
When selecting this flaw, you may opt to discuss with your GM for a standardized effect to occur, such as loss of control of your character, an ally is struck by lighting, or some other appropriate thematics for the ability, though depending on the nature of this the GM may reduce or increase the discount amount of this flaw.
For some examples, a critical success goes too far and also causes a negative effect, a success is considered a success with threat, or a success with threat is considered a success and a critical failure together.

name: Damage Type: Absorbed Alternate
description: This ability changes its damage type to match the most recently absorbed damage type from the Absorb Element effect.

name: Damage Type: Additional
description:
Allows damage dice of an additional damage type to be added to this ability. All damage types added this way are considered part of the same attack and successes may be spent in any of their tables. The target's lowest damage resistance is used (e.g slashing+fire damage dealt to a target with 5 slashing DR and 3 fire DR is reduced by 3). True damage may not be an additional type, use Damage Type: Alternate instead
If the target has Damage Resistance or Damage Immunity to one of the types in your attack, you still deal full damage but do not have access to the success effects for that type.

name: Damage Type: Alternate
description:
The Ability gains an alternative damage type that can be swapped between, one damage type per purchase.
Damage type is chosen when ability is used.
Differs from altered state in that all effects remain active, only damage type changes.

name: Damage Type: Alternate: AP Cost
description:
Requires Damage Type: Alternate . Changing damage type also inflicts an AP cost.
If this ability also has the Reloading flaw, the damage type may be changed as part of that effect.
xpCost:
-30 xp 1 AP
-50 xp 2 AP
-80 xp 3 AP

name: Damage: Absorb Type
description: This ability is able to deal the damage type of the last type of damage that struck the character

name: Damage: Add CHAR
description:
Adds the number of dice in a CHAR’s pool to the damage the attack deals.
This can only be purchased once per ability.

name: Damage: Charge Through
description:
Requires Damage: Charging Attack .
When you would make a Charging Attack, you no longer must give up all your remaining movement.

name: Damage: Charging Attack
description:
Requires a melee attack.
When you hit a target with this attack and have movement remaining and have traveled at least half your base movement distance, you may give up all remaining movement to deal half that movement as bonus flat damage.

name: Damage: Damage Split
description: The damage of this attack becomes split evenly between all creatures adjacent to the primary target and the primary target. If there are no targets adjacent to the primary target, it receives the full normal damage.

name: Damage: Killing Blows
description:
Whenever this ability deals damage, roll your damage dice twice and take the higher result and ignore the lower result.
Attacks made with this ability cannot make use of Holding Back rules and cannot deal Nonlethal damage.

name: Damage: Link to Environment
description:
The damage of this ability is modified by environmental factors.
Examples include throw a boulder where damage depends on the size of boulders around, or deal additional fire damage depending on ambient heat. The GM determines how much damage the ability will deal.

name: Damage: Moderate
description: Apply to a damage die to cause it to always give its average value instead of being rolled.

name: Damage: Object Destruction
description: Deal 3x damage to objects. If the object has Incredible Durability and the damage type this ability deals is not the one the object is vulnerable to, you may still deal normal (1x) damage to it

name: Damage: Pierce / Penetration
description: When dealing damage of the type chosen when this extra is bought, ignore a number of points of the target's Damage Resistance to that damage type.
tags: Damage Type, Damage, Pierce, Defense, Penetration

name: Damage: Random Damage Type
description: Convert all damage done by this ability to a random damage type selected via roll each time the ability is used.

name: Damage: Remove CHAR
description: Remove your primary CHAR from the damage of this ability

name: Damage: Vampirism
description: Whenever this ability deals damage, it also heals you for an amount linked to the damage you dealt.
xpCost:
+50% xp Half-damage to healing
+100% xp Full damage to healing

name: Defense: Type Restriction
description: The attached defensive effect may only trigger when the damage is of the type specified when this flaw is taken
xpCost:
-50 xp for a single damage type
-30 xp for single damage class (melee, ranged, magic, etc)

name: Defense: Use Mode Restriction
description: The attached defense effect may only trigger when the attack is not performed by the specified Use Modes (Ex: Charge Attack, Flurry Attack, Etc.)

name: Dice +1
description: Using the ability has an extra die, can stack
xpCost: 50 xp * the number of times this extra has been purchased (the second purchase is 100xp)
tags: Dice Roll, Buff, Passive, Self, Successes

name: Dice -1
description: Using the ability has one less die, can stack. Must be used on an ability that gains dice from some other Effect/Extra and may not go below the gained dice. Example: the ability gains 5 dice from the Character's FIT, the Dice -1 Extra may be added up to 5 times.
tags: Dice Roll, Flaw, Passive, Self, Successes

name: Disarming
description: When this ability targets an object via a called shot, if applicable that object is disarmed or otherwise knocked out of the owner's possession.

name: Distracting
description: If this ability causes a concentration check to be made as a result of its activation, the DC of that concentration check is higher.

name: Environmental Weakness: Disable Ability
description: Whenever your character is exposed to an environmental weakness, this ability is disabled completely for a number of rounds.

name: Excludes Target Type
description:
If the ability is used against a target that is considered part of the classification chosen when this flaw is taken, this ability can only deal a max of 1 damage and any other effects fail.
The XP refund of this flaw depends on how wide the chosen classification is, with more wide choices refunding more XP.
Examples: cannot affect ghosts, cannot affect metal objects, cannot affect Eldritch creatures, cannot affect living creatures
xpCost: -10 xp to -100 xp at GM approval

name: Fail Saves
description:
Requires a duration.
While this ability is active, you automatically fail saves for the specified CHAR

name: Failure Penalty
description:
Whenever this ability makes a check and fails, inflict a specified negative penalty on the creature who used the ability. This flaw is incompatible with abilities that award free successes.
If desired you may apply a negative status for the failure effect, refunding 50% of it's xp value.
xpCost:
-10 xp to -50 xp depending on severity of penalty
and/or
-50% of a status effect's xp cost

name: Forced Movement: Momentum Follow-through
description:
Requires Forced Movement: Momentum Transfer 
You no longer have to give up your remaining movement as part of momentum transfer

name: Forced Movement: Momentum Transfer
description: Requires melee attack. When you hit a target with this attack and have movement remaining, you can give up remaining movement (max of your movespeed for that movement type) to push the target that many squares directly away from you.

name: Full Power Only
description: The ability with this flaw attached may not make use the Hold Back rules to reduce the damage it deals or deal Nonlethal damage

name: Heal: Overheal
description: When this ability heals a creature, if the amount of healing is greater than the amount of HP the creature is missing, the remainder of the healing becomes temporary HP instead of being wasted. This effect can only trigger when the target creature is below or at their maximum HP and does not have temporary HP.

name: Infectious
description:
Requires Target: Save - Resistable or Target: Save 
This ability spreads from the afflicted creature to adjacent creatures on a failed save. Triggers when another creature ends their turn next to infected creature. Infection range can be increased by spending additional flat XP equal to the desired range (5xp per square)
Warning: Can break stuff be careful with indefinite durations.
xpCost:
+200% XP
Additional flat cost for infection range

name: Limited Uses (Consumables)
description: The ability may only be used a certain number of times before becoming inert. If this ability is purchased with XP these uses refresh on long rest.
tags: Object, Equipment, Limit, Flaw, Limited Use

name: Limited Uses: Recharge Condition
description: Requires Limited Uses (Consumables) . This ability restores a single use to the object when a condition is met.
xpCost: reduces the discount on this ability by 20%
tags: Object, Equipment, GM Approval, Buff, Ammo

name: Limited Uses: Recharge Time
description: Requires Limited Uses (Consumables) . This ability restores a single use to the object when a certain amount of time has passed.
xpCost:
Reduces the discount on this ability:
1/week: 5%
1/day: 10%
1/hour: 25%

name: Link to Weapon: Damage
description:
The damage of this ability will change to match the damage of an equipped weapon, but does not get any additional effects (improved critical etc)
This extra also applies to any healing dice a weapon applies to targets. If a weapon has both healing dice and damage dice, you must select which this extra applies to. You may take this twice to transfer both healing and damage.
Using this ability counts as using the linked one for any flaws (Class Resource Cost, Requires Setup, Reloading etc)
Any additional damage/healing on this ability counts as the one buff allowed for damage/healing of the ability.

name: Link to Weapon: Duration
description:
The duration of this ability is equal to the duration on the linked ability. You cannot have this extra and any other duration modifiers
Using this ability counts as using the linked one for any flaws (Class Resource Cost, Requires Setup, Reloading etc)

name: Link to Weapon: Effects
description:
When this ability strikes, it also activates any abilities attached to the currently equipped weapon
Using this ability counts as using the linked one for any flaws (Class Resource Cost, Requires Setup, Reloading etc)

name: Link to Weapon: Range
description:
The range of this ability becomes the range of an equipped weapon
Using this ability counts as using the linked one for any flaws (Class Resource Cost, Requires Setup, Reloading etc)

name: Luck: Threatened Odds
description: Whenever this ability gains threat from the Fate die rolling a natural 1, it removes successes from the roll result in addition to the normal threat effects.

name: Merchant Price
description:
If you pay someone to make an item for you, this is the standard amount extra they'd like to be paid.
Merchants follow player crafting rules when obtaining items that don't already exist in their inventory for time to craft / time to obtain.
If you need an item faster, consider adding Crafting: Quick Craftsman in combination with Single Use as a sub-effect.

name: Metaphysics Switch
description: When this ability is used, you may now choose (and announce for the GM to know) whether the ability is following physical or metaphysical rules instead of the ability being locked to one or the other at creation.

name: Mountable
description:
Requires Minions or Object . The minion or object now counts as a mount under mounting and mounted combat rules.
If the object is equipment, any creature with the object equipped becomes mountable.
xpCost:
30 xp per controller seat
10 xp per passenger seat

name: Movement Type: Charge
description: When using movement attached to this ability, the creature may only move in straight lines and must stop at any obstacle they are unable to pass over
xpCost: cost of each square of movement is reduced by 10xp

name: Movement: Triggers Move
description: Using this ability allows the creature to make a movement action as part of the ability
xpCost: 20% of the cost of any additional movement per [Movement: Increase]

name: Movement: Triggers Natural Movement
description: When this ability is used trigger a move action as part of this ability's use.

name: Negatable
description: Effect can be cancelled by an enemy with a 2 AP action, ex: extinguish a fire, punch to interrupt a spell

name: Nonlethal Only
description: The ability with the flaw attached must always deal non-lethal damage, and must have a non-lethal damage type (bludgeoning, cold, electric,  psionic, or light.)

name: Overkill
description: When you kill a creature with more damage than it had remaining HP, you may redirect the remaining damage to a second target. Ranged attacks can hit a target directly behind the original target up to a maximum of the ability's range. Melee attacks can hit another target within your reach.

name: Overkill - Reaper
description:
Requires Overkill
Whenever you kill a target with Overkill you may continue to carry damage to the next valid target.

name: Reaction: Extra Reactions
description: Requires Reaction and an AP cost of 0. Allows an additional use of the 0 AP reaction for each purchase of this extra, bypassing normal once-per-round restrictions.

name: Reaction: Hyper Reactive
description: Requires Reaction and an AP cost of 0. Removes the normal 0 AP restriction to allow this reaction to be taken additional times per turn. The reaction can be used any number of times, but each consecutive use in the same turn increases the DC of the ability's check by 1.

name: Reloading
description: After using this ability, you must use a number of AP to reload it before it can be used again. When applied to a weapon, the weapon attack may not be used until reloaded even if it has multiple abilities attached.

name: Reloading: Magazine
description: Requires Reloading . Reloading AP cost may be deferred a number of uses by reducing discount.

name: Reloading: Partial Reload
description:
Requires Reloading: Magazine . Part of the AP cost of reloading can be spent ahead of time to restore a proportional amount of uses, rounding down to the nearest whole amount.
For example: a 4-shot magazine that costs 4 AP to reload may spend 1 AP to reload 1 shot.

name: Reloading: Unload
description: Requires Reloading: Magazine  and a sub-effect under it. When this sub effect is activated remove multiple uses of the ability instead of a single one.

name: Requires Active Effect
description: Requires a specific effect to be active on your target.

name: Requires Active Effect - Dispel
description: Requires Requires Active Effect . The active effect is dispelled when you use this ability, even if that ability is normally dispel immune.

name: Requires Additional Success Spent
description: Create a sub-effect on this ability and attach this flaw. You must spend additional successes to activate this sub-effect, and if not the ability activates without activating those sub-effects.

name: Requires Consumable
description:
You must consume an object or a number of smaller objects specified when this flaw is taken in order to use this Ability. The player must keep track of how many of these objects they possess and they must not be an item so easily obtained and stored as to make this flaw meaningless. 
At GM discretion more expensive or difficult to obtain consumables may increase the discount offered from this flaw.

name: Requires Damage Type
description:
The attached effect can only successfully activate when the damage the overall Ability would deal is of the specified type chosen when this flaw is acquired.
This flaw is only valid on Abilities where the damage type is variable in some manner.

name: Requires Directionality
description:
The ability can only successfully activate when your position relative to the target is as indicated by this flaw.
Examples such as being above an enemy or behind them.

name: Requires Item
description: Ability needs a special focus item to use, must be more specific than generic terms like “weapon”, such as “sword” or "mage staff"
xpCost:
-30 xp
-50 xp for a specific instance of an item

name: Requires Setup
description: The ability may only be activated while setup, which is an action that requires AP. Remaining setup requires that the character or object remain stationary. If the character or object moves out of their square by any means they must use the setup action again in order to use this ability.
xpCost:
-80 xp for a setup with AP cost of 1
-15 xp each additional AP cost for setup

name: Requires Strong Foes
description: The ability can only successfully activate on creatures considered Elite or higher, otherwise it automatically fails

name: Requires Target Type
description:
If this ability is used against a target that does not meet a narrative classification chosen when this flaw is taken, then the ability can only deal a max of 1 damage and any other effects fail.
The XP refund of this flaw depends on how wide the chosen classification is, with more narrow choices refunding more XP. 
Examples: Only affects Undead, only affects stone, only affects people named Dan.
xpCost: -10 xp to -100 xp at GM approval

name: Requires Toggle
description: This ability may only be activated while toggled active, which is an action that requires AP. This lasts until the end of encounter by default, but can be ended by spending the AP again.

name: Requires Weak Foes
description: The ability can only successfully activate on creatures considered to be of Grunt or Troop rank, otherwise it automatically fails

name: Requires: Breakthrough
description: To activate this ability you must spend Breakthrough points

name: Requires: Currency
description: In order to activate this ability you must consume the required amount of currency.

name: Requires: Damage over Time
description: Requires the target to have a Damage effect with a duration on it. You must select the specific type of damage (slashing, fire, etc) for this flaw

name: Requires: ReRoll
description: To activate this ability you must spend ReRoll points

name: Requires: Status
description: This ability may only affect a creature so long as it is already under the effect of the specified status effect.
xpCost:
-xp equal to the xp cost of the chosen status effect
If the status is ranked, choose how many ranks are required and multiply the base amount by that (no scaling)

name: Requires: Status - Cleanse
description: Requires Requires: Status  flaw. When you trigger this ability, the required status is cleansed from the target. This only applies to negative status effects on enemies and positive status effects on allies (no clearing buffs from an enemy as a flaw)
xpCost: Discount equal to the Requires: Status flaw

name: Roleplay: Flawed
description: This flaw has a roleplay effect to it. It could be painful to use, or pleasurable, or even make you appear to be a horrible person.

name: Roleplay: Room Quality
description:
Requires Object: Structure .
Increases the quality of the room/area and its decorations for roleplay purposes.
xpCost:
10 xp for basic room
30 xp for decent room
50 xp for quality room
80 xp for high quality room
100 xp for a decadent quality room

name: Social: Disreputable
description:
When activated, this ability causes the target(s) to lose respect, or otherwise more greatly dislike your character.
This flaw is not valid on abilities that already do so, such as attacks, stealing, etc.
This flaw also renders the ability unusable on targets that are already hostile.

name: Social: Requires Humiliation
description: This ability may only be used on a creature that has been recently defeated in Social Combat.

name: Soul Link: Full Transferral
description:
Requires Soul Link: Statuses . 
Statuses held by your partner when soul link ends are no longer automatically returned to you. This is primarily useful combined with Soul Link: Parasite

name: Soul Link: Parasite
description:
Soul link may now be cast upon unwilling creatures as an attack roll. Any redirected damage applies as an attack allowing damage resistances to apply.
Any statuses transferred via the link may be saved against with a DC3 RES check to return them to the link origin.
xpCost: 20 xp per 10% of damage that may be transferred, maximum 90%

name: Soul Link: Requires Soul Link
description: The attached ability may only target creatures currently under the effect of a Soul Link to the user, otherwise the ability automatically fails.

name: Status: Breakthrough Resistant
description:
Requires an ability that applies a status effect. If the target of this ability spends a breakthrough point in order to immediately end the effect, it costs an additional breakthrough point to remove. 
Each at the start of each round, the amount of breakthrough points required to end the effect decreases by 1 back to the normal cost of 1.

name: Stealth: Obvious
description:
This ability is loud, flashy, obnoxious, or generally super obvious. Creatures anywhere near you clearly notice this ability activating, and treat it as having passed an Analyze check for knowing how the ability works.
This applies Creature is unable to benefit from Stealth, Invisibility, Subtle, or similar effects. Any of these effects present are immediately ended, and the benefits of the Subtle Extra are temporarily suppressed. to you automatically

name: Stealth: Sneak Attack
description:
Allows attacking another creature with the potential for that creature not to definitively identify which creature or location caused the attack.
When a creature is hit by a sneak attack, they must make a CUN check with a DC set by the sneak attack, if they fail, they know they were targeted, by not by who.

name: Stealth: Subtle
description:
Makes the Ability harder for other creatures to notice by making it quieter, more subtle, requiring less movement, etc. 
Gives the ability a DC for perception and Analyze checks to notice the ability activate or Identify it’s effects.
Creatures without you inside their perception radius do not notice this action activate.
xpCost:
50 XP for DC 3+1/2 Primary
100 XP for DC 4+1/2 Primary
150 XP for DC 5+1/2 Primary
Ect.

name: Subeffect Uses
description: Select a subeffect. For each purchase of this, that subeffect can be used an additional time

name: Successes +1
description: Using the ability guarantees one success, can stack
xpCost: 80 xp * the number of times this extra has been purchased (the second purchase is 160 xp)
tags: Dice Roll, Buff, Passive, Self, Successes

name: Successes -1
description: Using the ability removes a success from the dice results rolled. If the number of successes becomes negative, the check becomes a critical failure.

name: Sundering
description: Causes damage dealt by this attack to ignore up to 10 points of damage resist all when attacking objects.

name: Targeting: Creatures Only
description: This ability may no longer target objects.

name: Targeting: Objects Only
description: This ability may no longer target creatures.

name: Targeting: Self-harm
description: You are no longer exempt from taking damage from your own attacks, particularly AoE attacks that target your own space.

name: Targets a power source.
description:
Requires optional rule: Power Sources
This ability can only target effects or creatures with the listed power source

name: Terrain: Damaging
description:
Requires Terrain: Create  or Terrain: Difficult 
This ability is able to alter the terrain into a form that is harmful to pass through, such as spikes, pools of green stuff, and similar.
xpCost: 30 xp per square + value of damage dice dealt.

name: Terrain: Damaging - Avoidable
description:
Requires Terrain: Damaging 
The damage from the terrain can be avoided by treating it as difficult terrain, if the terrain is already difficult the creature must also succeed a DC 3 FIT save to move safely.

name: Terrain: Temporary Alterations
description:
Requires: Terrain: Create , Terrain: Difficult , or Terrain: Destroy 
Convert the ability into a duration effect that lasts 1 round by default. When the ability ends, the terrain changes are reverted automatically.

name: Triggers Attack of Opportunity
description: Using this ability triggers an attack of opportunity from any creatures that threaten your square

name: Triggers Attack of Opportunity: Left Wide Open
description: Using this ability triggers an attack of opportunity from any creatures that are aware of you and have at least one weapon attack that can reach you, any attacks that this ability provokes do not consume AP

name: Triggers Defensive Opportunity
description:
When this ability activates, it provokes a Defensive Opportunity, allowing enemies other than the target to spend 1 AP to trigger their move action to move into the targeted creature's square and substitute themselves for the target for any ability effects.
If the ability dealt damage in an area, the original target does not take the area damage for this turn, even if they remain in the area after being substituted.

name: Unavoidable: Half Effect
description: This ability always deals some of its damage, even when it misses its target. When this ability's attack roll fails, still roll half damage / apply half ranks of a ranked status / apply half of some other effect.

name: Universal Sub-Effect
description: This ability is a sub-effect for all other abilities you have. Effects with scaling costs (e.g. damage) don’t stack with the source ability, or count as the one allowed buff to the effect.

name: Unreliable
description: Whenever this ability rolls a 1 on the fate die during a check, the ability fails, regardless of the number of successes rolled.

name: Utility: Illusion - Reactive
description:
Requires Utility: Illusion. You may now use 1 AP to take the "Control Illusions" action. This is a concentration effect that while active you may have your illusions move and react according to your will, though they may not change entirely without recasting them.
Example: you may puppet a the illusion of a human to 'react' to another creature or keep an illusion in place over yourself as you move.

name: Utility: Illusion - Solid
description: Requires Utility: Illusion. Your illusions now feel solid under casual inspection, though forceful attempts (such as attacks) will still pass through.

name: Utility: Increase Size Limit
description:
Increase the size category of objects and creatures you may affect with this ability when dealing with the amount of mass your ability interacts with.
For example, how big an object you can lift with telekinesis, how much water you turn into acid, etc.
By default, you may only affect size 0 objects and creatures.

name: Utility: Sticky
description:
This ability is 'sticky' in whatever way makes sense for the context of this ability. 
This can be used for things like sticky grenades, a flaming arrow that sticks into walls, covering yourself in tar and hugging an enemy, etc.

name: Utility: Telepathy - Hostile
description: Allows telepathy to make an attack roll to force a telepathic connection with an unwilling creature

name: Utility: Teleport - Fixed Destination
description:
Requires Utility: Teleport . Objects and Creatures affected by your teleport must be sent to a fixed location, instead of any location within range. 
Examples: objects teleport to your hand, creatures teleport to a square adjacent to you.

name: Utility: Teleport - Tethered
description: Requires Utility: Teleport . You may designate one target object in your possession or destination when this effect is purchased. You may teleport this object to you or teleport a target to this destination within the range of this ability with all range multiplied by 10.

name: Wealth: Money is Power
description: When using this ability you may add damage dice to a single instance of this ability by spending gold equal to the XP value of the damage dice added
